title: What is Phishing?
body: Phishing is when scammers pretend to be someone you trust to trick you into sharing information, clicking fake links, or downloading harmful files.
tips: Verify using official apps or sites

check.question: Phishing usually tries to make you…
options: Share personal info or click harmful links
Win genuine prizes from real companies
check.explanation: Phishing aims to steal info or push you to unsafe actions.

title: Urgency & Pressure
body: Scammers create panic like ‘Your account will be locked in 1 hour’ so you react fast.
example: Your account will be closed today. Click here to keep it active.
tips: Pause, breathe, and verify on the official site

check.question: “Your account will be closed in 30 minutes” is mainly…
options: An urgency tactic to rush you
check.explanation: It’s a pressure trick to make you act without thinking.

title: Passwords & Personal Info
body: Legitimate companies will never ask for passwords or PINs by email or SMS.

check.question: It’s okay to email your password if the logo looks real.

title: Attachments & Downloads
tips: Only open files you expect from known contacts
If unsure, ask through another channel

check.question: Which is riskier from an unknown sender?
check.explanation: .exe files can run code on your device.

title: What to Do If You Clicked
body: Don’t panic. Run a security scan and change passwords for important accounts.

check.question: After clicking a weird link, best first move is…
options: Run a security scan & change passwords
